clinical_study.brief_title: Pupillometry and Pain Thresholds Patients Substituted by Methadone and Buprenorphine
clinical_study.official_title: Pupillometry and Pain Thresholds Patients Substituted by Methadone and Buprenorphine.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose is to study the relation between pupillary diameter measured under scotopic conditions, and the pain thresholds measured at the time of peak and residual effect of methadone/buprenorphine in opiate-dependent patients following a substitution program.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the last dose of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: - The mechanical punctuate pain threshold as measured by Electronical Von Frey
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the last dose of treatment, 3 hours after the last dose of methadone and 1 hour ½ after the last dose of buprenorphine

secondary_outcome.measure: - The mechanical pressure pain threshold measured by Algometer on the tibial bone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the last dose of treatment, 3 hours after the last dose of methadone and 1 hour ½ after the last dose of buprenorphine

secondary_outcome.measure: - The pupil diameter measured in scotopic .conditions (via infrared camera) at the hypothetical peak effect of either methadone or buprenorphine.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the last dose of treatment, 3 hours after the last dose of methadone and 1 hour ½ after the last dose of buprenorphine

secondary_outcome.measure: - The pupil diameter measured in photopic conditions (via infrared camera) at the hypothetical residual effect of either methadone or buprenorphine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the last dose of treatment, 3 hours after the last dose of methadone and 1 hour ½ after the last dose of buprenorphine

intervention.description: To study the relation between pupillary diameter measured under scotopic conditions, and the pain thresholds measured at the time of peak and residual effect of methadone / buprenorphine in opiate-dependent patients following a substitution program.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- substitution treatment stable since at least 3 months
- capacity to understand the protocol
- likely to come to visits
- covered by French welfare
Exclusion Criteria:
- chronic pain
- concomitant acute pain
- pregnancy or breast feeding
- relevant mental disease
- peripheral neuropathy
- diabetes
- regular intake of ketamine
- neuroleptic concomitant treatment

clinical_study.keyword: previous illicit drug intake, under a substitution program
